results.title: As you like it
results.creator_credit: Basil Coleman, Cedric Messina, Time-Life Films and BBC
results.brief_description: Orlando is forced to flee to the forest to escape the evil plots of his jealous brother, Oliver. Rosalind incurs her uncle’s wrath and also flees to the forest, accompanied by Celia and Touchstone the clown. Disguised as a youth known as Ganymede, Rosalind meets Orlando who confides his love for Rosalind to Ganymede (Rosalind). Oliver arrives in the forest and is saved from certain death by Orlando and the two brothers are reconciled. Oliver woos Celia, Touchstone woos the dullwitted Audrey, Silvius (a shepherd) woos Phoebe and Phoebe woos the disguised Rosalind who finally reveals her identity to Orlando. The four pairs of lovers are united in the feast of Hymen.

results.title: Grace Kelly - the American Princess
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly became the most sought after actress of her time and an Academy Award winner at 24. Having mastered her craft and at the height of her career, she stunned the world by choosing to leave Hollywood and become Her Serene Highness, Princess Grace of Monaco. Her remarkable story is told through film clips, home movies and interviews with Jimmy Stewart, Alec Guinness, Stanley Kramer, Louis Jourdan and others. Rated: PG

results.title: Gregory Peck - His Own Man
results.brief_description: In Hollywood where many actors scramble for success - and are desperate to hold onto it - Gregory peck has taken chances. While he has become one of Hollywood’s most illustrious stars (49 movies in 39 years) Peck has always remained his own man. Rated: PG

results.title: The Blizzard of Aahhh's
results.brief_description: Take three of the world’s best stunt skiers - cliff-jumper Scot Schmidt, extreme skier - Bad boy Glen Plake, and precision skier Mike Hattrup … transport them to the finest steep terrain in the world - from Switzerland to France’s Chamonix Valley to California’s awe inspiring Squaw Valley … engage some slick cameramen … set the results to an original soundtrack ranging from hot rap to Euro-funk, including Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Propaganda and ACT … and what do you have? “The Blizzard of AAHHH’s” - a vividly photographed, tightly edited rock video movie. Ever bolder jumps, twists, straight shots through chutes, games of chicken with crevasses and other activities designed to make insurance company rate-setters squeal with delight! Rated: G

results.title: Jamaica Inn
results.brief_description: Maureen O’Hara is a beautiful damsel in distress who must contend with the madness of the evil Squire Pengallon, the chief of a band of cut throats who lures ships onto the rocks in Victorian times. The opening of the film sets the tone: a “Jamaica Inn” sign half in gloom buffeted by wind and rain. Charles Laughton is memorable as the evil Squire. Rated: PG

results.title: The Lady vanishes
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a British group, en route to England by train from Switzerland. When a dear old lady disappears, a young woman seeks the aid of a fellow passenger to turn sleuth in an attempt to locate her. Something is amiss. Not all the travellers are who they appear to be. Cast: Michael Redgrave, Margaret Lockwood, Dame May Whitty, Paul Lukas, Cecil Parker.

results.title: Vincent
results.brief_description: Vincent Van Gogh died, a pauper, on 29 July 1880 at the age of 37. In less than ten years he had produced some 1,800 works, only one of which had been sold. This film is a meditation on the actual paintings and drawings of Van Gogh, and the influences upon him. The script is made up entirely of letters the artist wrote over 18 years to his beloved brother Theo and these are read by British actor, John Hurt.

results.title: Lifeboat
results.brief_description: A small band of men and women survive the sinking of an Allied freighter by a German U-boat, only to find themselves dependent upon a Nazi they rescue from the sea into their lifeboat. With the help of a John Steinbeck script and bravura performances from a cast that includes Tallulah Bankhead, Walter Slezak and Hume Cronyn, Hitchcock transforms the cramped confines of the lifeboat into a bigger-than-life battlefield of good and evil. “Lifeboat” is a tour de force only the Master of Suspense - Alfred Hitchcock could have created.

results.title: Throne of blood
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Taketoki Washizu is a general serving-hand and Tsuzuki, the master of Cobweb Castle. Prompted by his wife, Washizu murders Tsuzuki and takes command of Cobweb Castle. He is killed in battle when the son of a rival warlord, one of his victims, attacks the castle. Kurosawa’s visually atmospheric version of Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” stars Toshiro Mifune.

results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: Michael Gordon, Stanley Kramer and Stanley Kramer Films
results.brief_description: Based on Edmond Rostand’s classic play this film version has Jose Ferrer in an Academy Award winning performance as the long nosed Cyrano. Famous for his skill with words Cyrano mocks pompous noblemen, protects the poor and displays unmatched bravery but he nurses a secret love for his beautiful cousin Roxanne, who is also loved by a handsome but inarticulate soldier, who seeks Cyrano’s help in wooing her. Also stars Mala Powers and William Prince.
